story.text: [[Henning Diedrich]], the founder of [[Lexon]] introduces a new way to code [[smart contract]]s. Using [[natural language processing]].
Lexon enables, non-coders, lawyers, philosophers, hackers and students of the future to create decentralised code (smart contracts) on the blockchain.

# Concepts
What is a smart contract, and how can we democratise the process of creating the laws and code that govern our every day lives in an increasingly technologically driven society? 

- [[Future Law]], [[Law]], [[Smart Contract]]
# Workshop Details

Future Law

Afternoon Day 1, Friday 25th October
Start: 15:55  -  End: 17:30

Henning Diedrich
Founder and CEO of Lexon

Dr David Bovill
Scientist, artist. Founder of Liquid Democracy

Workshop: The Age of Consent

From work to our personal lives, how do we agree on where (our) boundaries are? What is consent? How does it differ from other forms of decision making? And what do you need to make it work?
Vincent van der Lubbe, Chair of Sociocracy for All, will guide you through the logical steps of consent, help you experiment with how they can work and what challenges lie ahead.
# Workshop Details

The Age of Consent - Decision Making for Now

Vincent van der Lubbe
Chair Sociocracy for All / Hansei Consulting

Afternoon Day 1
Saturday 25th October
Start: 15:55  -  End: 16:20

item.text: What is a smart contract, and how can we democratise the process of creating the laws and code that govern our every day lives in an increasingly technologically driven society?

Henning Diedrich, the founder of Lexon introduces a new way to code smart contracts. Using natural language processing, Lexon enables, non-coders, lawyers, philosophers, hackers and students of the future to create decentralised code (smart contracts) on the blockchain.
